column5: I'll be up on Scugog, my 6th year there. Last year was a little slow, but landed over 40 on the opener 2006
I'm moving that weekend, anyone wanna help?
I will be at work delivering until about 9AM, but I will finish just down the street from my favourite fishing hole. So by about 9:30AM or so I will have caught five to ten smallies.....
Sounds like a good hole you got there!
i will be in this area    The south shore of lake nipissing for 4 days then home for 2 then back up here for 12  I can't wait!  Cheers!
small, quiet pond about 3 km's outside of westport
You've got to carry it to the pond yourself, that's why I got a float tube so I don't have to lug that battleship around anymore  jjcanoe
I'll be fishin Monck Lake in Cardiff Ont. Hoping to get into some big Smalies..
Will be at stony all week 28th-5th.  Coming from ohio for my yearly trip.  Will be staying at Wantasa as usual.  If you ever see a guy and a girl in a bass tracker, give 'em a wave.  Jay
LOL.  Already helping Addy79 move into his new home that weekend.  He'll have to repay my time with a trip to SECRET BASS LAKE X, somewheres south of Parry Sound

I am probably being a little optimistic only on account of being restricted from using smallie candy there this year. Not being able to use their favorite bait is going to put a lot more largies into play. So I might wind up having to work for smallies this year. Last year on the opener I had 4 fish in 5 casts... and the only reason I didn't have to walk home was I drove and had the keys my buddy got skunked that will teach him to stand on shore smoking while I was gathering the smallie candy LOL. It was a beautiful start to the year.
Just wondering where everybody is going for opening day for bass?  I will be heading down to the cottage in Long Point with the family for a 4 day weekend!

I unfortunately probably won't get out for bass opening weekend, i'll be at a family reunion up near the Sault, i'd better fish for something at least!  Good luck out at Long Point, it'll be a zoo out there.
Always is! But this year I start fishing at 12:01 AM
muskie fishing.  unfortunately bass opener is after muskie season starts and i just don't get a chance to fish for them.
Long Point Bay! Never miss the bass derby.
Back on the St.Lawrence near Montreal hopefully I can spot that Roy guy  Saturday in his boat with the new fast motor if its not a blurr.
be at the cottage in muskoka fishin a few secret bass holes
I might crash jjcanoe's bass opener on "Pond X" if he'll lend me his canoe!
Wading the Thames  JF
Wiarton area for some big smallmouth...took the boat up to the lake about 3 wks ago. Got my cabin booked for the weekend and many more.
Pike fishin' on the West Arm!!!
Ditto......stupid bass......always grabbing my line....they are a PITA.

I know quite a few people that look forward to bass opener just as much as a kid at Christmas, for me no real allure to go just "bass fishing" for the day, I figure I catch enough of them throughout the year while fishing for everything else that it doesn't matter...reminds me of a time me and a buddy where at camp trying to scope out a couple spots for pickereyes, the first spot we tried ..between the 2 of us we probably boated about 30 smallies of all mixed sizes in under an hour, it was litterally almost every cast we each had on on..it got to the point that we where laughing our mule off over the fact that we where cathcing so many fish but still though it was a bummer cuz it wasn't what we where after at the time.

33rd Annual Invitational Bass Classic.  Good Friends and Traditions. And like jwl said, I'm one of those that the opening of Bass Season is like Christmas Eve.  The only thing that helps me get to sleep is the alcoholic consumption at the fire the night before!
Out on Lake Nipissing for some smallies
Up at the cottage near Bancroft.  Oh ya.  First time at the cottage this year.  Might be the only boat there.  Very little traffic which is nice.

At work!    But then up to the parent's place in Muskoka on Saturday night to take a few casts while it's still opening day...maybe even do a little midnight bassin'....?  Hmmmm....won't have the boy-child with me....probably do a little secret back-lakin' on the Sunday.
I'll be spending the opener on a back lake in Muskoka. No fishing pressure and I'll have the lake to myself....HEAVEN !!!  It'll probably be this lake    Have a great opener !!!  Hookset.
I,ll be up helpping out David Chong with his big brother/sister kids fishing day. It was a blast last year. If a certin angler asks, I may try flipp,n and pitch,n for some buckets Sunday.
With any luck PatrickG and I should be forging through the Grand in search of some fun
Stoney Lake, all of it.
Weslemkoon...first time up there!  should be fun!
I'll be out on the Bay of Quuinte watching 75 bass boats go whiz'nn by while I'm reeling in the hogs.
Dont ya just love that feeling.LOL
i'll be in the 1000 islands, out of gananoque...on the last day of our houseboat trip
